title: Developing Instructional Design Strategies Using Bibliometric Analysis in Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Includes literature analysis and data visualization activities using digital devices (laptops/tablets)

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze over 1,000 academic papers in science education using bibliometric methods.
Learners can reinterpret major theoretical frameworks (e.g., Cognitive Load Theory) applied in instructional design for modern educational environments.
Learners can propose instructional design models reflecting emerging STEAM education trends (e.g., computational thinking).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
